name: Copenhagen Initiative for Central America and Mexico
goal:
CIFCA "aims to promote participatory EU policies that contribute to the integral respect for human rights, democratization and a just and sustainable development in Central America and Mexico" (Art. 3 of the Statutes).

It strives for the promotion and protection of human rights, participatory democracy and a sustainable and inclusive development to be the backbone of all the EU policies related to Central America and Mexico.

The practices of political dialogue, development cooperation and trade between these two regions should be governed by these guiding principles and, as an essential element of the agreements between the two regions, the possibilities of enforceability and justiciability should exist.
interests: Development, External Relations, Food Safety, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Humanitarian Aid, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Trade
euInitiatives:
The impact on human rights of the Association Agreement between the EU and Central America.
The modernization of the Global Agreement between the EU and Mexico
The EU-Mexico Human rights Dialogue
EU Strategic Framework and Action Plan on Human Rights
EP annual report on Human rights
